mentionables.file: Using Kubernetes Pods as Jenkins Pipeline Build Agents (202412051700).md

messages.content:
Here are some relevant notes from the file:

### Key Points

* Create a Kubernetes cluster using Minikube and Docker as the driver.
* Install kubectl to interact with the Kubernetes cluster.
* Create a Jenkins container using the Jenkins LTS image.
* Configure Jenkins to use the Kubernetes cluster as a build agent.
* Create a service account and token for Jenkins to use as credentials.

### Steps to Follow

* Create an instance on AWS and install Docker.
* Install and start Minikube to create a Kubernetes cluster.
* Pull the Jenkins LTS image and create a Jenkins container.
* Configure Jenkins to use the Kubernetes cluster as a build agent.
* Create a pipeline job in Jenkins to test the integration.

<smtcmp_block filename="Using Kubernetes Pods as Jenkins Pipeline Build Agents (202412051700).md" language="markdown">
## **Relevant Links**

- Minikube installation instructions: https://minikube.sigs.k8s.io/docs/start/
- kubectl installation instructions: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/tools/install-kubectl/
- Jenkins installation instructions: https://www.jenkins.io/doc/book/installing/
- Kubernetes cluster creation instructions: https://kubernetes.io/docs/setup/production-environment/tools/kubeadm/create-cluster-kubeadm/
</smtcmp_block> 
( Note: I've added these links based on general information available. You might need to adjust or add more as per your specific needs )
